definition: to await job assignment (term used only in mainland China)
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: The company also accepts and develops piece of dee-casting for other lines.
sentences.chinese: 并承接和开发其它待业压制件。

sentences.english: Family income also had a influence on joblessness.
sentences.chinese: 家庭收入对于待业问题也有影响。

sentences.english: Those searching for jobs in Yulin and Chiayi regions are welcome to attend this expo.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎云嘉地区各校同学及待业民众前往求职。

sentences.english: They will take any sort of jobs anywhere rather than be unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以在任何地方从事任何职业而不愿意在家待业。

sentences.english: After the marriage Christina was unemployed and John was still working part time.
sentences.chinese: 婚后，克里斯蒂娜在家待业，约翰继续做兼职。

sentences.english: I have been unemployed a really long time.
sentences.chinese: 我待业真的已经有好长一段时间了。

definition: to quit one's job (without having another one)
(coll.) to live with and depend on one's parents even upon reaching adulthood
student graduating in the current year/recent graduate
older (than average in a group, at school, for marriage etc)
